intro: Phaca curtipes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phaca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several narrow, elongated leaflets. Phaca curtipes is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
